Reviews.Title: “Spring Training Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice and central location for the different stadiums that were visited. Rooms were okay but not thoroughly cleaned. The breakfast in the morning was pretty lame; cold cereal, bread and coffee. The price was right for what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: travlindr
Reviews.Content: We go to Phoenix several times a year on personal business. We tend to stay at this hotel. It is a good deal for the price. Rooms are acceptably clean, beds are comfortable, the free breakfast is barely adequate, but you can order a full breakfast for $4. Pool and hot tub are nice. We are returning this month and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK EVEN IF YOU'RE DESPERATE!”
Reviews.Author: epalent31
Reviews.Content: If I could give it no stars, I would! I have never stayed in such a filthy, disgusting and RUDE place in my life! I wouldn't stay here if it were FREE!!! We went here for a short one night trip to Phoenix while we were looking for apartments to rent out and nothing worked! We made a complaint to the manager (and then had to call customer service who did NOTHING!) about the facility because of the rude service we encountered when we informed them of the numerous long, red hairs (I have brown hair!) that were found in our towels and cold shower that I had to take because the water wasn't working. The manager then went on to say that "they were embedded in the wash." I uploaded pictures of the towels but we'll see if they post them. They were not embedded but rather picked up from the ground and re-folded after the previous guest used them. The company stands behind certain "standers" and the first core value that was stated on their "plaque" of promises wasn't upheld. We didn't receive the "warm hospitality and clean comfortable rooms where everything work[ed]" and even though our expectations were not met, [our] needs [were not met] in a timely manner" (Days Inn Promise from plaque). They gave me a measly 25% discount and mocked me when I demanded my money back. The room wasn't clean or ready for us so why should I pay for less than mediocre service and accommodations which could have made me sick!?!?!?! How are they still in business!?!?!?!?

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Sandra K
Reviews.Content: Very dirty, walls scuffed and run down. Our room not ready when we checked in, when we did go to our room, it smelled musky and moldy! Shower/bathroom were also dirty Very dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kathy H
Reviews.Content: The pool and courtyard area is very attractive and well kept, the restaurant and bar are OK. The rooms, hallway and elevator are dirty. We had a weekly rate which was very economical.When we checked in we were given keys to a room that was not yet cleaned and had to move our luggage to the 4th floor, after I had requested a 1st floor room because of a disability. Other than that the staff was courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mia11111
Reviews.Content: We entered the building and found it to be very unkept. The elevator floor seemed like it had never seen a vacuum, there was weird smell in the hallway. My sheets on my bed had cigarette holes in them, the bathroom had peeling sheet rock, door peeling paint like it was exposed to water damage. There so called complimentary breakfast consist of white bread,cheerios,mini muffin and coffee. I had asked the gentlemen who was keeping an eye on every one...( to make sure we signed in...really !!!! For this. !! ) if menu changes and he said no...this is all they offer.!! Oh and here's the kicker...we decided to take the staires and found the door to our floor had the handle broken off !!! NOT SAFE !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, dirty, loud, and uncomfortable. A complete dump!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahanne113
Reviews.Content: My mom and I were looking for somewhere to stay in march, which happened to be spring training, and only picked to stay here because it was under $100. It felt like highway robbery!! First off, the smell is absolutely terrible...a mixture between smoke and mildew. Even though we had a non smoking, the smokers were just doors away. The whole place feels dirty and dumpy, the carpet probably hadn't been vacuumed in a week and the elevator was full of grafitti. Our rooms had nothing but a broken picture and broken "nightstand" thing, and the bathrooms were gross. I had black hairs all over my towel and all over the shower. I also only went in the bathroom and shower in my flip flops...I'm not picky but the floor was so yucky looking. The toilet took 3 flushes to clear itself, and the instructions on how to use the confusing shower made no sense. My blanket had some sort of yellowish brown statins all over it, and my moms had ciragrette burns on it. Our night was not very restful either due to the constant slamming of doors and loud talking from rooms up and down the hallway and below us in the parking lot. I also heard a very loud scream in the hallway at 3 am. The "breakfast" in the morning contained nothing but sliced bread from the grocery store laid out to look pretty and Cheerios...we went to McDonalds instead. For $80, it was an absolute joke and insult to have to stay here. All we wanted was a clean and safe feeling hotel room to enjoy our weekend but we couldn't even get that. At all costs avoid this one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Feb25-Mar3, 2012 while visiting St Joseph Hospital”
Reviews.Author: lazyhfarm
Reviews.Content: Upon first entering this building I wasn't sure I had made the right choice. I traveled from Ohio with my mother to visit my Aunt in the hospital. I chose this hotel for its low rates to be honest. That being said, they gave me a discount because of visiting someone sick in hospital. For the price I could not expect the "Hilton". I felt the elevator and the hallway smelled like a cigar. Did not like that, however once in my room I turned on the air and after a few minutes it was better. The convenience to the light rail system was great. I walked less than a block to catch it and had to walk 2 blocks to get to the hospital. That saved me a lot of money. The security at the hospital would even pick me up and bring me back if needed or if I stayed after dark. That was awesome. The continental breakfast was just ok and I did eat it a few days. However for a small fee of $3.99 plus tax you can get an upgrade to any item on the breakfast menu. Between my mom and I we tried most of these breakfasts. They were very delicious and the waiter was absolutely awesome. He is a very, very nice man and very courteous and helpful.( I do not know his name but would like to Thank Him very much) He would ask about my Aunt everyday. That was a special touch. Thank you very much for that ! The bed was comfortable. When I needed something I would ask and I got it. So, it is an unexspensive hotel. Do not come here expecting way more than you pay for. However, if you need to visit someone in St. Joseph and can not spend an arm and a leg I would suggest you use this hotel. If you are looking for a resort, maybe not. However, even though I did not get to use the pool, I did sit by it and it was nice. The laundry was convienient and the fitness room was ok. Thank you all for being so helpful while visiting my Aunt.

Reviews.Title: “No way this a recently renovated hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn570
Reviews.Content: The website told me the hotel had just been renovated. No way! The room smelled moldy, the carpet was old and dirty. The tile was coming off in the bathroom. The bed mattress was old and not comforable at all. The plumbing was terrible! You are alternatedly cold or scalded with hot water even without changing the dial on the shower! The walls are thin and the next door rooms noisy. The ammenities are lacking... there are none. I even asked the front desk about the claim that the hotel had just been renovated. They said: "Yes it has". It must have been renovated to 1970's retro with the old moldy old dumpy furniture thrown in for effect! For the price I paid, I expect better than this. Clean and comfortable at least... which it was not. Even had to ask for washcloths, as none were provided in the room. Just two bath towels and one hand towel. Had to request toilet paper, too, as all that was there was one roll almost out. Had to wait over 30 minutes to get what I requested. The continental breakfast? Not much to choose from and most of that not replaced quickely when it was out from previous diners. Not ever staying at this hotel again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “stayed a whole week visiting from orlando florida”
Reviews.Author: sexyblkchick29
Reviews.Content: i honestly had a nice experience staying at this hotel,the staff was very nice and helpful with any questions i had as far as where to go in the city and how to get there !my room was very compfortable and i felt safe.........=and very afordable

Reviews.Title: “Molding/Smelly room”
Reviews.Author: June C
Reviews.Content: Since I am a travel agent, and my clients wanted a hotel in mid town of Phoenix, AZ, I booked them with this hotel for the price and location. My client later called to tell me that room was molding smelling room I have myself stayed at Days Inn, and so did my client, this hotel needs upgrading if they want to stay in business.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn You Should Be Ashame”
Reviews.Author: warren w
Reviews.Content: Old run down dirty my blanket had bubble gum on it several places . No security guard on duty , Open door entry from poorly lit back parking lot . Witnessed two fights in area front parking lot that night . With group 22 young ladies that were harrased by from man on same floor he opend door kept yelling help me help me front desk no help at all . We took chairs from room and posted our own guards in hallway . Scale 1-10 we give it a minus 5 ...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location and Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: Wafflek9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Days Inn a few weeks ago and had a great time. The staff was friendly, rooms were clean, and no hassles with parking. It was a short walk to the light rail which made for easy and safe commuting to bars downtown. Never used the breakfast because it ends too early, but had dinner in the restaurant and it was good and plentiful, very interesting place with an outdated feel but a good following of locals like it was their secret. The pool was beautiful, the other public areas and rooms need some updating which the new GM said is slated to begin next summer. Overall I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient budget hotel close to amenities”
Reviews.Author: levado
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a busy road close to amenities (stores, restaurants, car hire) and is right next to one of the light rail stations. That means it will cost you only USD 1.75 to get here from the airport (much cheaper than a taxi at USD 30-35) - you need to take the free airport shuttle to 44th/Washington which is the terminus for the airport shuttle bus, then buy a single ticket from here at the ticket machine for the light rail to the hotel. The ticket machine gives change by the way, all in dollar coins. This option is feasible if you don't have too much luggage and it's not too heavy. I stayed here both at the start and end of my vacation and rented a car from Enterprise just along the road, and you pay far less in city tax if you hire a car from a location outside the airport, so this is a good location in this respect also. I was able to bathe in the swimming pool behind the hotel and the weather is almost always hot and sunny, so most people will be able to avail themselves of this opportunity. The free breakfast is fine, but nothing to write home about, only cereal, toast, pancakes and fruit and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “sleepless in Phoenix...”
Reviews.Author: Charlene F
Reviews.Content: location was good but the non-smoking room still smell like smoke and the beds were very, very, very lumpy, loud and old. The beds were very uncomfortable to try to sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Maintenance is an Issue”
Reviews.Author: IncurableAdventurers
Reviews.Content: This hotel appears to have been a nice property a couple decades ago, and the sad thing is it could still be pleasant, but maintenance needs to be addressed. I'm sure management could resolve all the issues we noticed if they put a little TLC into the property. First, the pool area was lovely, it is one of the rare hotel pools that is not only large, but also deep, reaching 10 feet. The hot tub was also large. But here is the problem, the palm trees in the courtyard have not been groomed and maintained, and therefore pigeons roost in the palms. There were droppings all around the pool area, and feathers everywhere, including the pool and hot tub. Nasty. Determined to get in the hot tub after a long drive we fished out the feathers and proceeded to get in. The jets appeared to be plugged and wouldn't work properly, and the water stunk. Let me say again, this was a real shame because the pool is a very nice area, but it certainly needs attention. Our room was spacious, comfortable and relatively clean. It even had a mini fridge. But, the shower would not drain. When we took our showers after the stinky hot tub experience, and then again in the morning, the water just collected in the tub until we were standing in half a foot of tepid shower water. So again, this is troublesome because just a little maintenance would resolve this unpleasant issue. Over all, I would not go so far as to give this property a 'terrible' rating, but I will not be staying there again unless I hear management has evicted the pigeons and unclogged the drains.

Reviews.Title: “Great location BUT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LVBeachlover
Reviews.Content: The Days Inn Camelback has a Great location and a very nice staff BUT.. The condition of the Hotel is Very POOR!!!!! If this Hotel would renovate I think that it would be MUCH Better...

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here because Air Conditioning at home was Out and this was the closest .”
Reviews.Author: Sandy G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in my neighborhood and I'm ashamed by what we found. As one other reviewer stated, the sheets were stained and the room smelled like stale cigarette smoke. The front desk person didn't seemed phased by the issues. I had to go to the desk to get clean sheets and to the store to spray for the odor. There were abandoned cars in the parking lot. Back door wasn't secured at all. Some guy came in with his bike and pail to get ice out of the ice machine. I later saw him urinating outside the back door. Had to laugh at the pet fee we were charged, pets are the least of their worries. Would have tough it out at home if it wasn't for the dogs. Too bad, this place is in a great location. At least glad we haven't sent any family or friends there.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Nice Pool, Inexpensive, Don't Expect Much from "Breakfast"”
Reviews.Author: boB M
Reviews.Content: For the price the Days Inn Camelback Phoenix and Conference Center is a bargain. However there always seem to be some hiccups in quality or service that keep it just average in my book. I will stay here again in spite of these hiccups-hey, it's inexpensive and gives me a decent night's sleep (with earplugs). The Good: -VERY nice pool area and pool/hot tub -Friendly, accommodating staff -Large, fairly clean rooms -Inexpensive -WiFi internet worked well (though at times slowly) The Bad: -This trip they ran out of towels and pillow cases one day. Had to wait some time for them to be replaced (they took the old ones, so didn't have ANY towels), but when I complained they quickly responded (about 1/2 hour after I complained) with hot, just laundered ones... -"Breakfast" as they call it consists only of mini muffins, mini cinnamon rolls, thin everything bagels (onions for breakfast?) and cream cheese, a couple of cereals, some past-their-prime apples and oranges, juice, coffee and milk. The Ugly: -Toilet often had to be flushed repeatedly to fully evacuate waste. -Noise from street or other guests isn't very well insulated against. -This trip there were parties and slamming doors happening all hours of the night (even at 4 AM) and staff members (while friendly and sympathetic) weren't very effective in resolving noise complaints. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel, with the caveat that it can be noisy... For the price I still think it's a good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: Missdriff
Reviews.Content: I was worried when I read reviews from some of the people who had stayed here but we had a great time and the staff was wonderful. The pool was clean as was our room. When I asked for a refrigerator it was brought up right away. For the price we'd go back there again. It was easy to locate from the airport. The room was quiet and the beds were comfortable. We did have to get air freshener because at first it smelled a little musty but it did the trick. The bathroom was basic but the shower had good water pressure. A/C worked fine. The restaurant/lounge was awesome! Wish they had been open fourth of July weekend but we were there from June 28th through July 5th so we got to enjoy it before the weekend. Very friendly crowd at the lounge with a great bartender. Food was good. Other reviews said the neighborhood was scarey but it is Phoenix go a block one way and it will be fine go the other way and it will be scarey. The light rail was right there although we didn't make use of it. I thought it might be noisy because of that but it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good rates, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: jahulbert
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was unsure about staying here. What a surprise! The rooms were average but clean. The pool area superb. And the staff were more than helpful. All in all I was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. Beds/sheets were so dirty I slept on the floor.”
Reviews.Author: kham8480
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate experience of staying at the Days Inn in November 2010. I had read the less-than-flattering reviews before I went but unfortunately had no choice to stay there as I was with a tour. The hotel smelled strongly of smoke, even though my friend and I were in a non-smoking room and the rooms were filthy. The base of my bed had a smear of blood on it, which I found revolting beyond belief. I couldn't bring myself to sleep in the bed, especially since I had read the hotel has bed bugs and blood smears are a sure sign the bed is infested, so I slept on a makeshift bed (made out of my clothes) at the front door, trying to keep my luggage and myself as far away from the bed as I could. I agree with previous reviewers about the hotel being in a dodgy area too. Someone tried to get into my room in the middle of the night, and there were shady characters roaming the halls late at night. In the end, I practically skipped out of the hotel in the morning. I couldn't wait to leave. In the end, it may be cheap, but is it worth getting bed bugs/getting robbed? I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “RESPONSIVE STAFF AND A DELIGHTFUL GARDEN / POOL”
Reviews.Author: skyz4us
Reviews.Content: A pleasure to check in and a clean, comfortable and good size room. Minutes from the light rail and a short walk to some fun restaurants including Postino and Hula. Relaxing garden, large pool plus hot tub ... hard to go to work!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience- I recommend”
Reviews.Author: ragenandnine
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean. Staff was excellent-friendly/helpful. Restaurant food was high in quality and taste- low in price. I had an excellent visit of 4 days, and enjoyed every moment. Wish I were still there. I felt like the staff really cared that your needs were met. Also felt the location was close to everything I was looking for. Even the other guest were friendly- I think this happens when people feel that they are getting value for the money spent. Price was great for the quality of service!

Reviews.Title: “Sleep in your car, It'll be cleaner & more comfortable”
Reviews.Author: paqman016
Reviews.Content: You'd better be desperate for a room to stay here! were down there for BCS championship game & chose this because of location & brand name. The list of negatives is too long to post, but I'll just say: horrible beds & linens, hair from previous guests stuck to shower curtain, poor water pressure in shower, no way to control water temp. in shower, etc.....

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST - DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Brizzz
Reviews.Content: This place was disgraceful!! DO NOT STAY HERE!! We checked in late afternoon after a long day of travelling. Our room (apparently non-smoking) reaked of tobacco / cigarettes. We asked to change, however, they stated they were 'full'?? We found this highly unlikely. The rooms were tacky, old and run-down, and the beds were springy and uncomfortable. The pillows were lumpy also. The location is also very dodgy! In the carpark we saw a violent domestic take place, a crack dealer try and sell us drugs and a car get broken into. The clientele that choose this motel also leave a lot to be desired. I know you can't choose who stays in your rooms, but I swear we saw hookers/pimps/druggies. Needless to say, it was a sleepless night. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: JackK644
Reviews.Content: We found 2 full grown bed bugs in the room and one of our party woke up covered in bites. Do not stay at this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Did the job - bed, air conditioning, great pool and jacuzzi!”
Reviews.Author: hayleyep
Reviews.Content: Only stayed there one night but found the place to be fine. No bed bugs to speak of. Staff were friendly and everything in the hotel was up to about 2-3 star standard as expected. Pool and jacuzzi were great. Only thing I found a little frustrating was turning on the shower! For us foriegners its normally hot and cold seperate taps but this thing had dials, levers, only one tap and was just super confusing! Instructions on how to use would probably be appreciated! Wasn't super close to Phoenix but public transport was close enough.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: PhotoWendy
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for one night. We were vacationing in Arizona and wanted a hotel somewhat close to the airport for our flight out the next day. I was traveling with my three children ages 16, 14 and 8. The hotel was a bit old, but basically clean. We got a great value for the price. The free breakfast was wonderful. There was a resterant, but we didn't eat there. My son swam in the pool the night of our stay and it was clean. At the time we were the only ones at the pool. I also saw a few families using it in the morning while we ate our breakfast. The staff was very courteous. Our ride to the airport the next day was quick and easy (around 1/2 hr during morning traffic). We would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you don't want your holiday spoiled”
Reviews.Author: cleopatra5647
Reviews.Content: Staff is rude, room are not clean. Someone was complaining in the lobby regarding bed bugs. Not recommended at all. If you don't want to bring little criters home reconsider booking somewere else.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Place”
Reviews.Author: travelfaninpa
Reviews.Content: Dirty place indeed. Fitness center is a joke. Close to lightrail, about its only attribute or highlight. Supposedly, the restaurant is award winning, but I ate downtown and at Westgate instead.

Reviews.Title: “I was very disappointed with the Staff!”
Reviews.Author: StephaniePhoenix
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be more disappointed with the staff they were very unprofessional rude people! I will not refer anyone at Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Our needs were met”
Reviews.Author: imeldastravels
Reviews.Content: Affordale, nice/new/firm beds, clean room, nice ambiance, helpful/polite front clerk, close to our business destination.

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: iamtravelinpam
Reviews.Content: The bedspreads were kind of loud and when we walked in one of the kids said, "Classy choice there navigator" (from the Goofy Movie). Very nice staff who attended to our extras that we requested. Paid a $20 pet deposit that was promptly refunded upon checkout. Breakfast area was in separate spacious room with mostly waffles, cereal, coffee and juice. Computer in lobby that was temporarily out of order during our stay. Grocery store around the corner. Room was comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Inexpensive Accomodations With Clean LARGE Rooms”
Reviews.Author: boB M
Reviews.Content: For the price I got a decent, clean, VERY large room. I arrived to find my King room not ready (after posted check-in time). The front desk clerk was friendly and made it right by upgrading me to a King Suite. This room was ENORMOUS. It was fairly sparsely furnished, but everything was clean and in line with what I expected for what I paid. I knew another guest who had a King room like I had booked. He also said his room was large and quite adequate for the price. The furniture was poorly planned and sparse in my opinion. The desk had one outlet you would have had to climb under to reach (outlet had no plate/cover). Since the desk was on wheels, I moved it in front of a window (where it should be in my opinion) to get a good view of the pool area and be near an accessible outlet. There was a HUGE space next to the bed where there should be a chair. The Good: VERY Inexpensive Clean, LARGE Room Pool Area Well Kept and Very Pretty Good Italian Restaurant on First Floor Light Rail Right in Front of the Building The Bad: Poorly Planned Furniture Placement Minor Maintenance/Upkeep Issues Door Felt a Little Flimsy (Didn't Shut Firmly) I'll be back on future trips through Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “I could perfectly mix business with pleasure”
Reviews.Author: budha01
Reviews.Content: Days Inn Camelback is a very typical motel, yet clean, not expensive and with all the facilities one would ask for. I was there with my husband and two children but at the same time I had to arrange few business meetings. That's why I chose it really and I paid ( through Easy Click web site) for a non smoking room with 2 queen beds, high speed internet access and a refrigerator less than 45$ a night. Although usually I try not to do it, that way I could perfectly mix business with pleasure for an absurd price.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some attantion”
Reviews.Author: lt_tigger
Reviews.Content: This is a copy of a email sent to the manage who never replied. Service was certainly lacking. 1. I had a do not disturb sign on my room until about 10:30 am. It was removed for the remainder of the day. When I returned at 5:00 the room was still not made up. I called the front desk and was abruptly told that is was my fault that I had the sign on. Every other hotel I stayed at will come back to see if the sign has been removed and make up the room. No clean towels, shampoo or coffee was delivered to the room when I returned I the evening. 2. While is is nice to allow pets, guest should not be allowed to have their pets in the pool area. One day a guest took his dog onto the grass and allowed his dog to urinate on it. Children were playing in that area a few hours earlier. 3. The lounge chairs at the pool have bird excrement on them. This has been there for the duration of my stay. This is a very unsanitary condition

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: pdxballard
Reviews.Content: The Good: The size of the room for the price was great. The room layout was a bit funky as it was suppose to be a suite but there wasn't a door to separte the living room area from the bedroom. The bathroom was huge with two sinks. The showerhead was too low for the average person. Although we didn't use them there was a sink, fridge, microwave and coffee maker along with two tv's and a pull out sofa. The location to the lightrail was a very important factor in our choice. Very close by to the 7th Ave. and Camelback stop. The airport has a shuttle that takes you to the lightrail station and from there it's about a 30 minute trip on the train. The Bad: A dead coakroach on the floor in the bathroom, very noticeable dur to it's large size. Better dead than alive though! The maids need to be better as there was also a nasty towel under our bed and a tissue behind a shelf unit. The elevators really needed to be vaccumed out. They should also have more irons and ironing boards available. They are not in each room so it's first come first serve, we had to ask repeatedly. The Ugly: The view out our second floor room was of the ac units. The property itself is not very attractive from the outside. Overall the value is what makes this hotel worth a recommendation. We were very happy with the price we paid for what we received. I understand that Days Inn just acquired the property so hopefully they take care of the issues and leave the price alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Nice Pool.”
Reviews.Author: DALBoston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now a Days Inn property. The clean room I had was well appointed and had free wi-fi access and continental breakfast. In the off season, I paid about $42 a night for a king room. There are four floors to the property and two buildings (north and south). Try to stay on the poolside of the buildings and the upper two floors of the south building as the second floor of the south building overlooks the roof and obscures any view of the pool. The pool was well taken care of and the pool area was clean and landscaped. The conference area was a bit sorry looking but I only went there for the free breakfast. The property is within two hundred feet of the Metro station if you need it. I thought this was a great value for the money.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Camelback Phoenix and Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 502 W Camelback Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85013 (Formerly Red Roof Inn)
